definition:
by the common action of : jointly engaging                                      
             
             shared the work between the two of them

in common to : shared by                                      
             
             divided between his four grandchildren

in the time, space, or interval that separates                                      
             
             the alley between the butcher shop and the pharmacy

in intermediate relation to                                      
             
             weighs somewhere between a pound and a pound and a half

from one to another of                                      
             
             air service between Miami and Chicago

serving to connect or unite in a relationship (such as difference, likeness, or proportion)                                      
             
             a one-to-one correspondence between sets

setting apart                                      
             
             the line between fact and fancy

in preference for one or the other of                                      
             
             had no difficulty deciding between the two

in point of comparison of                                      
             
             little difference between the two cars

in confidence restricted to                                      
             
             a secret between you and me

taking together the combined effect of                                      
             
             between work and family life, they have no time for hobbies

in an intermediate space or interval                                      
             
             two beds with a nightstand between
in the space that separates (two things or people)
in the time that separates (two actions, events, etc.)
—used to indicate the beginning and ending points of a group of numbers, a range of measurement, etc.                  —sometimes used in the phrase in between
in the space separating two things or people

in the time or space that separates                                      
             
             between nine and ten o'clock

functioning to separate or tell apart                                      
             
             What are the differences between soccer and football?

by the efforts of each of                                      
             
             Between us we can get the job done.

by comparing                                      
             
             You must choose between two things.

shared by                                      
             
             There's a strong bond between parent and child.

in shares to each of                                      
             
             She divided the money between the two children.

to and from                                      
             
             He travels between New York and Chicago every week.

in a position between others                                      
                

            The room has two desks with a table between.
in: shared the work between the two of them
talks between the three
divided between his four grandchildren
the alley between the butcher shop and the pharmacy
should arrive between 9 and 10 o'clock
weighs somewhere between a pound and a pound and a half
air service between Miami and Chicago
a one-to-one correspondence between sets
mutual understanding between them
the line between fact and fancy
had no difficulty deciding between the two
little difference between the two cars
a secret between you and me
between work and family life, they have no time for hobbies
two beds with a nightstand between
economic cooperation between nations
between you and me and the lamppost
partitioned between Austria, Prussia, and Russia
pausing between every sentence to rap the floor
discontent among the peasants
a worthy book that nevertheless falls among many stools
the author alternates among mod slang, clichés and quotes from literary giants
The ball rolled between the desk and the wall.
He stood between his mother and his father.
The office has two desks with a table between them.
They put up a fence between their house and their neighbor's house.
There are fences between all the houses.
If you want to lose weight, you shouldn't eat between meals.
Between bites of food, they talked to their teacher.
The two days between Monday and Thursday are Tuesday and Wednesday.
We should arrive between 9 and 10 o'clock.
The office has two desks with a table between.
between nine and ten o'clock
between the two desks
What are the differences between soccer and football?
Between us we can get the job done.
You must choose between two things.
There's a strong bond between parent and child.
She divided the money between the two children.
He travels between New York and Chicago every week.

definition: if someone or something is between two other people or things, the two people or things are on each side of them
connecting two places
in the period after one time or event and before the next
within a range of numbers, amounts, ages etc
used for showing which people or groups are involved in an agreement, discussion, competition, fight etc
used for showing that two things, people, organizations, or ideas are related or connected
used for stating which two people or things are similar or different
Nouns
used for showing how something is shared or divided
used for showing that the total amount of something is owned, given, or produced by two or more people
used for showing that you can choose one out of two or more things
in: Hold the needle between your finger and thumb.
Gatwick is about halfway between London and Brighton.
in between: Charlotte sat in between her two sons at the reception.
Put the two smaller vases on the ends and the big one in between.
Trains running between Liverpool and Manchester were delayed.
The office will be closed between Christmas and New Year.
The show opens next Monday. Between now and then we’ll be rehearsing every day.
in between: Try to avoid snacks in between meals.
I have two classes this morning, with a short break in between.
Choose a number between 1 and 10.
children between the ages of 4 and 13
in between: Fifteen is too few, but 30 is probably too many – somewhere in between would be about right.
a conversation between the Prime Minister and the President
The match between England and Germany will be worth watching.
There has been a steady improvement in relations between China and the rest of the world.
Scientists believe there is a link between diet and certain types of cancer.
Does a five-year-old know the difference between right and wrong?
There are obvious parallels between computer systems and the working of the human brain.
the gap between rich and poor
We agreed to split the profits between us on a fifty-fifty basis.
The head teacher has to divide up her time between administration and classroom teaching.
Between us, we managed to collect over £2,000.
They’re both beautiful designs – it’s hard to choose between them.
Third year students have a choice between philosophy, sociology, and economics.
(just) between you and me

definition: in or into the space that separates two places, people, or objects:
If something is between two amounts, it is greater than the first amount but smaller than the second:
in the period of time that separates two different times or events:
among two or more people or things:
A discussion, argument, or game between two or more people or groups of people involves both people or groups:
If you choose between two things, you choose one thing or the other:
connecting two or more places, things, or people:
from one place to another:
separating two places or things:
shared by or involving two or more people or things:
in: The town lies halfway between Rome and Florence.
Standing between the two adults was a small child.
She squeezed between the parked cars and ran out into the road.
There were two houses with a narrow path in between.
She weighs between 55 and 60 kilograms.
The competition is open to children between six and twelve years of age.
The room was either extremely cold or hot, never anything in between (= in the middle).
You shouldn't eat between meals.
There is a break of ten minutes between classes.

He visits his parents every month and sometimes in between.

There is a regular train service between Glasgow and Edinburgh.
The survey shows a link between asthma and air pollution.

The wall between East and West Berlin came down in 1989.
